info.title: Box Platform 2.0 APIs
info.description: The Box Content API gives you access to secure content management and content experience features for use in your own app. It strives to be RESTful and is organized around the main resources youâ€™re familiar with from the Box web interface.

get.description:
Authorize a user by sending them through the [Box](https://box.com)
website and request their permission to act on their behalf.

This is the first step when authenticating a user using
OAuth 2.0. To request a user's authorization to use the Box APIs
on their behalf you will need to send a user to the URL with this
format.

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: The type of response we'd like to receive.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description:
The Client ID of the application that is requesting to authenticate
the user. To get the Client ID for your application, log in to your
Box developer console and click the **Edit Application** link for
the application you're working with. In the OAuth2 Parameters section
of the configuration page, find the item labeled **client_id**. The
text of that item is your application's Client ID.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description:
The URL to which Box redirects the browser after the user has granted
or rejected the application permission. This URL must match the
redirect URL in the configuration of your application. It must be a
valid HTTPS URL and it needs to be able to handle the redirection to
complete the next step in the OAuth2 flow.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
A custom string of your choice. Box will pass the same string to
the redirect URL when authentication is complete. This parameter
can be used to identify a user on redirect, as well as protect
against hijacked sessions and other attacks.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of application scopes you'd like to
authenticate the user for. This defaults to all the scopes configured
for the application in its configuration page.

200.description: Does not return any data, but rather should be used in the browser.

post.description:
Request an Access Token using either a client-side obtained OAuth2
authorization code or a server-side JWT assertion.

An Access Token is a string that enables Box to verify that a
request belongs to an authorized session. In the normal order of
operations you will begin by requesting authentication from the
[authorize](#get-authorize) endpoint and Box will send you an
authorization code.

You will then send this code to this endpoint to exchange it for
an Access Token. The returned Access Token can then be used to to make
Box API calls.

200.description:
Returns a new Access Token that can be used to make authenticated
API calls by passing along the token in a authorization header as
follows `Authorization: Bearer <Token>`.

post.description:
Revoke an active Access Token, effectively logging a user out
that has been previously authenticated.

200.description: Returns an empty response when the token was successfully revoked.

get.description: Retrieves the details about a file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

200.description:
Returns a file object.

[Some fields are optional](#file) and need to be explicitly
requested using the [fields](#get-files-id--request--fields)
parameter.

post.description: Restores an file that has been moved to the trash.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

name.description: An optional new name for the file.

allOf.description:
The optional parent folder that the item will
be restored to.

Use this if the original parent folder no longer
exists, or the user no longer has access to the
original parent folder.

201.description: Returns a file object when the file has been restored.

403.description:
Returns an error if the user does not have access to the folder
the file is being restored to, or the user does not have permission
to restore files from the trash.

404.description: Returns an error if the file is not in the trash.

409.description:
Returns an error if there is an file with the same name
in the folder the file is being restored to.

put.description:
Updates a file. This can be used to rename or move a file,
create a shared link, or lock a file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Ensure this item hasn't recently changed
by ensuring the item's current `etag` matches the
`etag` passed into this header.

name.description: The new name for the file

allOf.description:
The parent folder for this file. Use this to move the file
or to restore it out of the trash.
Enables the creation of a shared link for this file
Creates a lock on a file. Set to `null` to unlock a file
Describes if a file can be downloaded and by who.

tags.description:
The tags for this item.

To add or remove a tag, retrieve the item's current tags,
modify them, and then update this field.

200.description:
Returns a file object.

[Some fields are optional](#file) and need to be explicitly
requested using the [fields](#get-files-id--request--fields)
parameter.

delete.description:
Deletes a file, either permanently or by moving it to
the trash.

The the enterprise settings determine whether the item will
be permanently deleted from Box or moved to the trash.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Ensure this item hasn't recently changed
by ensuring the item's current `etag` matches the
`etag` passed into this header.

204.description:
Returns an empty response when the file has been successfully
deleted.

412.description:
If the `If-Match` header was sent and the file has since changed, the
API will return a `412 Precondition Failed` error.

get.description: Returns the contents of a file in binary format.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: Range
parameters.description:
The byte range of the content to download.

The format `{start_byte}-{end_byte}` can be used to specify
what section of the file to download.

parameters.name: BoxApi
parameters.description:
The URL and password for a file that has
been shared using a shared link, as this file would otherwise
not be accessible to the user.

Use the format `shared_link=SHARED_LINK_URL` or if a password was set
use `shared_link=[link]&shared_link_password=[password]`

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The file version to download

202.description:
If the file is not ready to be downloaded yet `Retry-After` header will
be returned indicating the time in seconds after which the file will
be available for the client to download.

This response can occur when the file was uploaded immediately before the
download request.

Retry-After.description: The time in seconds after which to retry the download

302.description:
If the file is available to be downloaded the response will include a
`Location` header for the file on `dl.boxcloud.com`.

The `dl.boxcloud.com` URL is not persistent and clients will need
to follow the redirect in order to actually download the file.

Location.description: A pointer to the download URL

post.description:
Update a file's content. For file sizes over 50MB we recommend
using the Chunk Upload APIs.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Ensure this item hasn't recently changed
by ensuring the item's current `etag` matches the
`etag` passed into this header.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

parameters.name: Content-MD5
parameters.description:
An optional header containing the SHA-1 hash of the file to
ensure that the file was not corrupted in transit.

attributes.description: The JSON attributes of this request.

name.description:
An optional new name for the file. If specified, the file
will be renamed when the new version is uploaded.

content_modified_at.description:
Defines the time the file was last modified at.

If not set, the upload time will be used.

file.description: The content of the file to upload to Box.

200.description: Returns the new file object in a list.

options.description:
Performs a check to verify that a file will be accepted by Box
before you upload the entire file.

name.description: The name for the file

size.description: The size of the file in bytes

allOf.description: The parent folder to upload the file to

200.description:
If the check passed, the response will include a session URL that
can be used to upload the file to.

409.description:
If the check did not pass, the response will include some details on
why it did not pass.

post.description:
Uploads a small file to Box. For file sizes over 50MB we recommend
using the Chunk Upload APIs.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

parameters.name: Content-MD5
parameters.description:
An optional header containing the SHA-1 hash of the file to
ensure that the file was not corrupted in transit.

attributes.description: The JSON attributes of this request.

name.description: The name of the file

parent.description: The parent folder to upload the file to

id.description:
The id of the parent folder. Use
`0` for the user's root folder.

content_created_at.description:
Defines the time the file was originally created at.

If not set, the upload time will be used.

content_modified_at.description:
Defines the time the file was last modified at.

If not set, the upload time will be used.

file.description: The content of the file to upload to Box.

201.description: Returns the new file object in a list.

409.description:
Returns an error if the file already exists,
or the account has run out of disk space.

post.description: Creates an upload session for a new file.

folder_id.description: The ID of the folder to upload the new file to.

file_size.description: The total number of bytes of the file to be uploaded

201.description: Returns a new upload session.

409.description:
Returns an error if the file already exists,
or the account has run out of disk space.

post.summary: Create upload session for existing file
post.description: Creates an upload session for an existing file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

file_size.description: The total number of bytes of the file to be uploaded

file_name.description: The optional new name of new file

201.description: Returns a new upload session.

409.description:
Returns an error if the file already exists,
or the account has run out of disk space.

get.description: Return information about an upload session.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

200.description: Returns an upload session object.

put.description: Updates a chunk of an upload session for a file.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description:
The [RFC3230][1] message digest of the chunk uploaded.

Only SHA-1 is supported. The SHA-1 digest must be Base64
encoded. The format of this header is as
`sha=BASE64_ENCODED_DIGEST`.

[1]: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3230

parameters.name: Content-Range
parameters.description:
The byte range of the chunk.

Must not overlap with the range of a part already
uploaded this session.

200.description: Chunk has been uploaded successfully.

409.description:
Returns an error if the chunk conflicts with another
chunk previously uploaded.

412.description: Returns an error if a precondition failed.

416.description:
Returns an error if the content range does not match a specified range
for the session.

delete.description:
Abort an upload session and discard all data uploaded.

This cannot be reversed.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

204.description:
A blank response is returned if the session was
successfully aborted.

get.description:
Return a list of the chunks uploaded to the upload
session so far.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the item at which to begin the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

200.description: Returns a list of parts that have been uploaded.

post.description:
Close an upload session and create a file from the
uploaded chunks.

parameters.name: upload_session_id
parameters.description: The ID of the upload session.

parameters.name: Digest
parameters.description:
The [RFC3230][1] message digest of the whole file.

Only SHA-1 is supported. The SHA-1 digest must be Base64
encoded. The format of this header is as
`sha=BASE64_ENCODED_DIGEST`.

[1]: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3230

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Ensure this item hasn't recently changed
by ensuring the item's current `etag` matches the
`etag` passed into this header.

parameters.name: If-None-Match
parameters.description:
Ensures the changes are only applied if the
item's `etag` does not match the provided
`etag`, ensuring that the item is only updated
if the content has changed.

201.description: Returns the file object in a list.

202.description:
Returns when all chunks have been uploaded but not yet processed.

Inspect the upload session to get more information about the
progress of processing the chunks, then retry committing the file
when all chunks have processed.

Retry-After.description:
Indicates the number of seconds the client should wait before
attempting their commit request again.

409.description:
Returns an error if there is already a file with the same name
in the target folder.

412.description: Returns an error if the `If-Match` or `If-None-Match` conditions fail.

post.description: Creates a copy of a file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

name.description:
An optional different name for the new file.

Names can only contain basic, printable
ASCII characters, without any slashes or
trailing spaces.

Both `.` and `..` are protected names.

version.description: An optional ID of the specific file version you want to copy

parent.description: The destination folder to copy the file to.

id.description: The ID of folder to copy the file to.

201.description:
Returns a new file object representing the copied file.

[Some fields are optional](#file) and need to be explicitly
requested using the [fields](#post-files-id-copy--request--fields)
parameter.

409.description:
* `operation_blocked_temporary`: Returned if either of the destination
  or source folders is locked due to another move, copy, delete or
  restore operation in process.

  The operation can be retried at a later point.

get.description:
Retrieves a thumbnail, or smaller image representation, of a file.

Sizes of `32x32`,`64x64`, `128x128`, and `256x256` can be returned in
the `.png` format and sizes of `32x32`, `94x94`, `160x160`, and `320x320`
can be returned in the `.jpg` format.

Thumbnails can be generated for the image and video file formats listed
[found on our community site](http://community.box.com/t5/Managing-\
Your-Content/What-file-types-are-supported-by-Box-s-Content-Preview/\
ta-p/327).

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: The file format for the thumbnail

parameters.name: min_height
parameters.description: The minimum height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: min_width
parameters.description: The minimum width of the thumbnail

parameters.name: max_height
parameters.description: The maximum height of the thumbnail

parameters.name: max_width
parameters.description: The maximum width of the thumbnail

200.description:
When a thumbnail can be created the thumbnail data will be
returned in the body of the response.

202.description:
If the thumbnail is not available yet, a `Location` header
pointing to a placeholder graphic will be returned.

Retry-After.description:
The time in seconds after which the thumbnail will be available.

Your application  only attempt to get the thumbnail again after
this time.

Location.description:
A pointer to a placeholder graphic that can be used until the
thumbnail has been generated.

302.description:
If Box is unable to generate a thumbnail for this file type, a `Location`
header pointing to a placeholder graphic for this file type will be
returned.

Location.description:
A pointer to a placeholder graphic that can be used for this
file type.

404.description:
If Box is unable to generate a thumbnail for this particular file, `404`
will be returned with a code of `preview_cannot_be_generated`.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of collaborations for a file. This
returns all the users that have access to the file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the item at which to begin the response.

200.description:
Returns a collection of collaboration objects. If there are no
collaborations on this file an empty collection will be returned.

get.description: Retrieves a list of comments for a file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the item at which to begin the response.

200.description:
Returns a collection of comment objects. If there are no
comments on this file an empty collection will be returned.

get.description:
Retrieves a list of all the tasks for a file. This
endpoint does not support paging.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

200.description:
Returns a collection of task objects. If there are no
tasks on this file an empty collection will be returned.

404.description:
Returns an error if the file for the given ID does not exist or
is inaccessible to your account.

get.description: Retrieves a file that has been moved to the trash.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

200.description:
Returns the file that was trashed,
including information about when the it
was moved to the trash.

404.description: Returns an error if the file is not in the trash.

delete.description:
Permanently deletes a file that is in the trash.
This action cannot be undone.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

204.description:
Returns an empty response when the file was
permanently deleted.

404.description: Returns an error if the file is not in the trash.

get.description:
Retrieve information on all version of a file. This endpoint can be used to
retrieve information about older versions of a file.

Versions are only tracked for Box users with premium accounts.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset of the item at which to begin the response.

200.description:
Returns an array of file versions.

If there are no previous versions of this file an empty
array will be returned.

get.description:
Retrieve a specific older version of a file.

Versions are only tracked for Box users with premium accounts.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

parameters.name: file_version_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file version

200.description:
Returns a file object.

[Some fields are optional](#file) and need to be explicitly
requested using the [fields](#get-files-id-versions--request--fields)
parameter.

delete.description:
Move a file version to the trash.

Versions are only tracked for Box users with premium accounts.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: file_version_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file version

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description:
Ensure this item hasn't recently changed
by ensuring the item's current `etag` matches the
`etag` passed into this header.

204.description:
Returns an empty response when the file has been successfully
deleted.

post.description:
Revert to a previous version of a file.


If previous versions exist, this method can be used to
promote one of the older versions to the top of the version history.

This actually creates a new copy of the old version and puts it at the
top of the versions history. The file will have the exact same contents
as the older version, with the the same SHA1/etag, and the same name
as the original.

Other properties such as comments do not get updated to their
former values.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

schema.description: The file version to revert to

id.description: The file version ID

201.description: Returns a newly created file version object.

get.description: Retrieves all metadata for a given file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

200.description:
Returns all the metadata associated with a file.

This API does not support pagination and will therefore always return
all of the metadata associated to the file.

get.description: Retrieve a specific metadata template instance for a file

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the metadata template

parameters.name: template_key
parameters.description: The name of the metadata template

201.description:
An instance of the metadata template that includes
additional "key:value" pairs defined by the user or
an application.

404.description:
Returned if the metadata template specified
was not applied to this file.

post.description:
Creates a piece of metadata on a file based on the specified template.

Only values that are present in the metadata template
will be accepted.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the metadata template

parameters.name: template_key
parameters.description: The name of the metadata template

200.description:
Returns an instance of the template that was specified, with the
custom template data included.

409.description:
If the piece of metadata already exists, a conflict error
will be returned. The metadata can then instead be updated with the
`PUT` method.

put.description:
Updates a piece of metadata on a file.

The metadata instance can only be updated if the instance
already exists. When editing metadata, only values that adhere to the
metadata template schema will be accepted.

The update is applied atomically. If any errors occur during the
application of the operations, the metadata instance remains unchanged.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the metadata template

parameters.name: template_key
parameters.description: The name of the metadata template

schema.description:
A [JSON-Patch](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902)
specification for the changes to make to the metadata.
The changes are represented as a JSON array of
operation objects.

200.description:
Returns the updated metadata template instance, with the
custom template data included.

409.description:
If the piece of metadata already exists, a conflict error
will be returned. The metadata can then instead be updated with the
`PUT` method.

delete.description: Deletes a piece of file metadata.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the metadata template

parameters.name: template_key
parameters.description: The name of the metadata template

204.description:
Returns an empty response when the metadata is
successfully deleted.

get.description: Retrieve the watermark for a file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

200.description:
Returns an object containing information about the
watermark associated for to this file.

404.description: Returns an error if the file does not have a watermark applied.

put.description: Applies or update a watermark on a file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

watermark.description: The watermark to imprint on the file

imprint.description:
The type of watermark to apply.

Currently only supports one option.

200.description:
Returns an updated watermark if a watermark already
existed on this file.

201.description:
Returns a new watermark if no watermark existed on
this file yet.

delete.description: Removes the watermark from a file.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description: The ID of the file.

204.description:
An empty response will be returned when the watermark
was successfully deleted.

404.description:
Returns an error if the file did not have
a watermark applied to it

get.description:
Retrieves details for a folder, including the first 100 entries
in the folder.

To fetch more items within the folder, please use the
[Get items in a folder](#get-folders-id-items) endpoint.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represent a folder.

The ID for any folder can be determined
by visiting this folder in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the url `https://*.app.box.com/folder/123`
the `folder_id` is `123`.

The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the ID `0`.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
A comma-separated list of attributes to include in the
response. This can be used to request fields that are
not normally returned in a standard response.

Be aware that specifying this parameter will have the
effect that none of the standard fields are returned in
the response, unless explicitly specified.

200.description:
Returns a folder, including the first 100 entries in the folder.

To fetch more items within the folder, please use the
[Get items in a folder](#get-folders-id-items) endpoint.

[Some fields are optional](#folder) and need to be explicitly
requested using the [fields](#get_folders_id-fields)
parameter.

403.description:
Returned when the access token provided in the `Authorization` header
is not recognized or not provided.

404.description:
Returned if the folder is not found, or the user does not
have access to the folder.

405.description: Returned if the `folder_id` is not in a recognized format.

post.description:
Restores a folder that has been moved to the trash.

# Folder locking

During this operation, part of the file tree will be locked, mainly
the source folder and all of its descendants, as well as the destination
folder.

name.description:
The name for the new folder.

There are some restrictions to the file name. Names containing
non-printable ASCII characters, forward and backward slashes
(`/`, `\`), as well as names with trailing spaces are
prohibited.

Additionally, the special names `.` and `..` are
not allowed either.

400.description:
Returns an error if some of the parameters are missing or
invalid.

* `bad_request` when a parameter is missing.
* `item_name_too_long` when the folder name is too long.

404.description:
Returns an error if the parent folder could not be found,
or the authenticated user does not have access to the parent
folder.

* `not_found` when the authenticated user does not have access
  to the parent folder

409.description:
Returns an error if a folder by this name already exists,
or if the parent folder is locked.

* `item_name_in_use` when a folder with the same name already
  exists.

post.description:
Creates a copy of a folder within a destination folder.

The original folder will not be changed.

# Asynchronous copying

If the folder being copied contains up to 500 items the copy will
happen synchronously with the API call. The call will not return until
the copy operation has completed.

If the folder contains more than 500 items the copy operation will be
executed asynchronously and the API call will return directly yet before
the copy operation has completed. We currently have no API to check when
a copy operation has finished.

# Folder locking

During this operation, part of the file tree will be locked, mainly
the source folder and all of its descendants, as well as the destination
folder.

For the duration of the operation, no other move, copy, delete, or restore
operation can performed on any of the locked folders. Most importantly, this
means that the same folder can not be copied to two different parts of the
folder tree at the same time.

# Metadata

If the destination folder has a metadata cascade policy attached to any of the
parent folders a metadata cascade operation will be kicked off asynchronously.

We currently have no API to check when this operation has finished.

get.description: Searches for items that are available to the user or an entire enterprise.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
The string to search for. This query is matched against item names,
descriptions, text content of files, and various other fields of
the different item types.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description:
Limits search results to a user scope.

Defaults to `user_content` which limits the search to content
available to the current user

Setting this to `enterprise_content` widens the search to content
available to the entire enterprise. To enable this scope for an
administrator, please reach out to support.

parameters.name: file_extensions
parameters.description:
Limits search results to a comma-separated list of
file extensions.

parameters.name: created_at_range
parameters.description:
Limits search results to items created within
a given date range.

Date ranges are defined as comma separated RFC3339
timestamps.

If the the start date is omitted (`,2014-05-17T13:35:01-07:00`)
the earliest known date will be used as the start date instead.

If the end date is omitted (`2014-05-15T13:35:01-07:00,`) the
current date will be used as the end date instead.

parameters.name: updated_at_range
parameters.description:
Limits search results to items updated within
a given date range.

Date ranges are defined as comma separated RFC3339
timestamps.

If the she start date is omitted (`,2014-05-17T13:35:01-07:00`)
the earliest known date will be used as the start date instead.

If the end date is omitted (`2014-05-15T13:35:01-07:00,`) the
current date will be used as the end date instead.

parameters.name: size_range
parameters.description:
Limits search results to items within a given file size
range.

File size ranges are defined as comma separated byte sizes.

The upper and lower bound can be omitted to create open ranges.

parameters.name: owner_user_ids
parameters.description:
Limits search results to items owned
by the given list of owners.

Owners are defined as a comma separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: ancestor_folder_ids
parameters.description:
Limits search results to items within the given
list of folders.

Folders are defined as a comma separated lists
of folder IDs.

Search results will also include items within subfolders.

parameters.name: content_types
parameters.description:
Limits search results to items with the given
content types.

Content types are defined as a comma separated lists
of Box recognized content types.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Limits search results to items of this type.

parameters.name: trash_content
parameters.description:
Controls if search results include the trash.

Defaults to `non_trashed_only`

parameters.name: mdfilters
parameters.description:
Limits search results to items that match the
metadata template name and content.

parameters.description: The offset of the item at which to begin the response.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return per page.

For externally managed users, the search term needs

it will only return one user at a time.

parameters.name: user_type

  `filter_term`. It will only return an external user

  and in that case it will only return that user.
* `managed` returns all managed and app users for whom
  the `login` or `name` partially matches the
  `filter_term`.
* `external` returns all external users for whom the
  `login` matches the `filter_term` exactly.

new folder in another userâ€™s account.

Only the root folder (`0`) can be transferred.

Folders can only be moved across users by users with administrative
permissions.

This call will be performed synchronously which might lead to a slow response
when the source user has a large number of items in all of its folders.

If the destination path has a metadata cascade policy attached to any of
the parent folders, a metadata cascade operation will be kicked off
asynchronously.

There is currently no way to check for when this operation is finished.

by visiting this folder in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the url `https://*.app.box.com/folder/123`
the `folder_id` is `123`.

The root folder of a Box account is
always represented by the ID `0`.

name.description: The name of the new group to be created

provenance.description:
Keeps track of which external source this group is
coming, for example "Active Directory", or "Okta".

Setting this will also prevent Box admins from editing
the group name and its members directly via the Box
web application.

This is desirable for one-way syncing of groups.

external_sync_identifier.description:
An arbitrary identifier that can be used by
external group sync tools to link this Box Group to
an external group.

Example values of this field
could be an **Active Directory Object ID** or a **Google
Group ID**.

We recommend you use of this field in
order to avoid issues when group names are updated in
either Box or external systems.

description.description: A human readable description of the group.
description.example: "Customer Support Group - as imported from Active Directory"

invitability_level.description:
Specifies who can invite the group to collaborate
on folders.

When set to `admins_only` the enterprise admin, co-admins,
and the group's admin can invite the group.

When set to `admins_and_members` all the admins listed
above and group members can invite the group.

When set to `all_managed_users` all managed users in the
enterprise can invite the group.

member_viewability_level.description:
Specifies who can see the members of the group.

* `admins_only - the enterprise admin, co-admins, group's
  group admin

coming, for example "Active Directory", or "Okta".

Setting this will also prevent Box admins from editing
the group name and its members directly via the Box
web application.

This is desirable for one-way syncing of groups.

An arbitrary identifier that can be used by
external group sync tools to link this Box Group to
an external group.

Example values of this field
could be an **Active Directory Object ID** or a **Google
Group ID**.

We recommend you use of this field in
order to avoid issues when group names are updated in
either Box or external systems.

on folders.

When set to `admins_only` the enterprise admin, co-admins,
and the group's admin can invite the group.

When set to `admins_and_members` all the admins listed
above and group members can invite the group.

When set to `all_managed_users` all managed users in the
enterprise can invite the group.

  group admin

* `all_managed_users` - all managed users in the

options.description:
Returns a list of real-time servers that can be used for long-polling updates
to the [event stream](#get-events).

Long polling is the concept where a HTTP request is kept open until the
server sends a response, then repeating the process over and over to receive
updated responses.

Long polling the event stream can only be used for user events, not for
enterprise events.

To use long polling, first use this endpoint to retrieve a list of long poll
URLs. Next, make a long poll request to any of the provided URLs.

When an event occurs in monitored account a response with the value
`new_change` will be sent. The response contains no other details as
it simply serves as a prompt to take further action such as sending a
request to the [events endpoint](#get-events) with the last known
`stream_position`.

After the server sends this response it closes the connection. You must now
repeat the long poll process to begin listening for events again.

If no events occur for a while and the connection times out you will
receive a response with the value `reconnect`. When you receive this response
youâ€™ll make another call to this endpoint to restart the process.

If you receive no events in `retry_timeout` seconds then you will need to
make another request to the real-time server (one of the URLs in the response
for this endpoint). This might be necessary due to network errors.

Finally, if you receive a `max_retries` error when making a request to the
real-time server, you should start over by making a call to this endpoint
first.

200.description:
Returns a paginated array of servers that can be used
instead of the regular endpoints for long-polling events.

get.description:
Returns up to a year of past events for a given user
or for the entire enterprise.

By default this returns events for the authenticated user. To retrieve
events for the entire enterprise, set the `stream_type` to `admin_logs`.
The user making the API call will need to have admin privileges, and
the application will need to have the permission to access the event feed
to get the enterprise event feed.

parameters.name: stream_type
parameters.description:
Defines the type of events that are returned

* `all` returns everything for a user and is the default
* `changes` returns events that may cause file tree changes
  such as file updates or collaborations.
* `sync` is similar to `changes` but only applies to synced folders
* `admin_logs` returns all events for an entire enterprise and
  requires the user making the API call to have admin permissions.

parameters.name: stream_position
parameters.description:
The location in the event stream to start receiving events from.

* `now` will return an empty list events and
the latest stream position for initialization.
* `0` or `null` will return all events.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of events returned

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of events to filter by.

items.title: Event Type
items.description: An event type that can trigger an event

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: The lower bound date and time to return events for.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: The upper bound date and time to return events for.

200.description:
Returns a list of event objects.

Events objects are returned in pages, with each page (chunk)
including a list of event objects. The response also includes a
`chunk_size` parameter indicating how many
chunks are left, as well as the next `stream_position` that can be
queried.

does not exist.

policy_name.description: The name for the retention policy

policy_type.description:
The type of the retention policy. A retention
policy type can either be `finite`, where a
specific amount of time to retain the content is known
upfront, or `indefinite`, where the amount of time
to retain the content is still unknown.

disposition_action.description:
The disposition action of the retention policy.
This action can be `permanently_delete`, which
will cause the content retained by the policy
to be permanently deleted, or `remove_retention`,
which will lift the retention policy from the content,
allowing it to be deleted by users,
once the retention policy time period has passed.

retention_length.description:
The length of the retention policy. This length
specifies the duration in days that the retention
policy will be active for after being assigned to
content.  If the policy has A `policy_type` of
`indefinite`, the `retention_length` will also be
`indefinite`.

can_owner_extend_retention.description:
Whether the owner of a file will be allowed to
extend the retention.

are_owners_notified.description:
Whether owner and co-owners of a file are notified
when the policy nears expiration.

200.description: Returns a new retention policy object.

400.description:
Returns a `bad_request` error with the `retention_length` was
specified for a `infinite` retention policy, or an incorrect
`disposition_action` was set.

filter_started_at.description:
The filter start date.

When this policy is applied using a `custodian` legal
hold assignments, it will only apply to file versions
created or uploaded inside of the
date range. Other assignment types, such as folders and
files, will ignore the date filter.

Required if `is_ongoing` is set to `false`.

filter_ended_at.description:
The filter end date.

When this policy is applied using a `custodian` legal
hold assignments, it will only apply to file versions
created or uploaded inside of the
date range. Other assignment types, such as folders and
files, will ignore the date filter.

Required if `is_ongoing` is set to `false`.

is_ongoing.description:
Whether new assignments under this policy should
continue applying to files even after initialization.

When this policy is applied using a legal hold assignment,
it will continue applying the policy to any new file versions
even after it has been applied.

For example, if a legal hold assignment is placed on a user
today, and that user uploads a file tomorrow, that file will
get held. This will continue until the policy is retired.

Required if no filter dates are set.

AccessToken.title: Access Token
AccessToken.description: A token that can be used to make authenticated API calls.

The refresh token for this access token, which can be used
to request a new access token when the current one expires.

issued_token_type.description:
The type of downscoped access token returned. This is only
returned if an access token has been downscoped.

AccessToken--Mini.title: Access Token Mini
AccessToken--Mini.description: The basics of an access token

token_type.description: The type of access token returned.

restricted_to.description:

providing a list of resources (files, folders, etc)
and the scopes permitted for each of those resources.

Collaboration.title: Collaboration
Collaboration.description:
Collaborations define access permissions for users and groups to files and
folders, similar to access control lists. A collaboration object grants a
user or group access to a file or folder with permissions defined by a
specific role.

allOf.description:
The file or folder to which access is granted. The field is
`null` when the collaboration `status` is `pending`.
The user or group that is granted access

invite_email.description:
The email address used to invite an unregistered collaborator, if
they are not a registered user.

expires_at.description:
When the collaboration will expire, or `null` if no expiration
date is set.

can_view_path.description:
Whether the "view path collaboration" feature is enabled or not. View
path collaborations allow the invitee to see the entire parent path to
the item. View path collaboration does not grant privileges in any
parent folder (e.g. cannot see content the user is not collaborated
on), other than the permission to view the parent path.

status.description: The status of the collaboration invitation.

acknowledged_at.description:
When the `status` of the collaboration object changed to
`accepted` or `rejected`

allOf.description: The user who created the collaboration object

created_at.description: When the collaboration object was created

modified_at.description: When the collaboration object was last modified

is_accepted.description:
Whether or not the terms of service have been accepted.  The
field is `null` when there is no terms of service required.

allOf.description:
The terms of service that must be accepted before the
collaboration can be accepted. The field is `null` when
there is no terms of service required.

enterprise_has_strong_password_required_.description:
Whether or not the enterprise that owns the content requires
a strong password to collaborate on the content.

user_has_strong_password.description:
Whether or not the user has a strong password set for their
account. The field is `null` when a strong password is not
required.

enterprise_has_two_factor_auth_enabled.description:
Whether or not the enterprise that owns the content requires
two-factor authentication to be enabled in order to
collaborate on the content.

user_has_two_factor_authentication_enabl.description:
Whether or not the user has two-factor authentication
enabled. The field is `null` when two-factor
authentication is not required.

A Collaboration Whitelist entry describes an

Collection.title: Collection
Collection.description:
A collection of items, including files and folders.

Currently, the only collection available
is the `favorites` collection.

The contents of a collection can be explored in a
similar way to which the contents of a folder is
explored.

name.description: The name of the collection.

collection_type.description:
The type of the collection. This is used to
determine the proper visual treatment for
collections.

Comment.description:
Comments are messages created on files. Comments
can be made independently or created as responses to other
comments

tagged_message.description:
The string representing the comment text with
@mentions included. @mention format is @[id:username]
where `id` is user's Box ID and `username` is
their display name.

Event.description: The description of an event that happened within Box

The user that performed the action represented by the event.
Some events may be performed by users not logged into Box.
In that case, not all attributes of the object are populated and the
event is attributed to a unknown user (`user_id = 2`)

The event type that triggered this event

The session of the user that performed the action. Not all events will
populate this attribute.

This object provides additional information about the event if available.

This can include how a user performed an event as well as additional
information to correlate an event to external Keysafe logs. Not all events
have an additional_details object.  This object is only available in the
Enterprise Events.

chunk_size.description: The number of pages of events remaining.

next_stream_position.description:
The stream position of the start of the next page
of events.

File.title: File
File.description:
A full representation of a file, as can be returned from any
file API endpoints by default

version_number.description: The version number of this file

comment_count.description: The number of comments on this file

allOf.description:
Describes the permissions that the current user has
for this file.

tags.description: All tags applied to this folder.

allOf.description:
The lock held on this file. If there is no lock, this can either
be `null` or have a timestamp in the past.

extension.description:
Indicates the suffix, when available, on the file. By default,
set to an empty string. The suffix usually indicates the encoding
(file format) of the file contents or usage.

is_package.description: Whether the file is a package. Used for Mac Packages used by iWorks.

expiring_embed_link.description:
Requesting this field creates an expiring URL for an
embedded preview session in an iframe.

This URL will expire after 60 seconds and the session will
expire after 60 minutes.

allOf.description: Information about the watermarking on this file

allowed_invitee_roles.description:
Folder [collaboration](#collaboration-object) roles allowed by the
enterprise administrator.

is_externally_owned.description: Whether this file is owned by a user outside of the enterprise.

has_collaborations.description: Whether this file has any collaborators.

metadata.description:
A list of key-value pairs of metadata objects within their
scopes.

To access the metadata for a file, first use the
[Metadata](#metadata) endpoints to determine
the metadata templates available to your enterprise.

The use the [Retrieve File](#get-file-id) endpoint with
the `fields` query parameter to get the metadata by ID. The
ID for the metadata template will be in the format
`metadata.<scope>.<templatename>`, for example
`fields=metadata.global.properties`.

additionalProperties.description: The name of the metadata template

FileVersionRetention.title: Retention
FileVersionRetention.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content
for a specified amount of time. Admins can apply policies to
specified folders, or an entire enterprise. A file version retention
is a  record for a retained file version. To use this feature,
you must  have the manage retention policies scope enabled for your
API key via  your application management console. For more information
about retention policies, please visit our help documentation

allOf.description:
The file version this file version retention was
applied to
The file this file version retention was applied to

When this file version retention object was
created

When the retention period expires on this file
version retention

allOf.description:
The winning retention policy applied to this file
version retention. A file version can have multiple
retention policies applied.

Folder.title: Folder
Folder.description:
A full representation of a folder, as can be returned from any
folder API endpoints by default

allOf.description:
Specifies if the user has marked Box Drive or their mobile apps
to sync this folder to their device.

has_collaborations.description: Specifies if this folder has any other collaborators.

allOf.description:
Describes the permissions that the current user has
for this folder

The tags for this item.

To add or remove a tag, retrieve the item's current tags,
modify them, and then update this field.

Specifies if users who are not the owner
of the folder can invite new collaborators to the folder.

is_externally_owned.description:
Specifies if this folder is owned by a user outside of the
authenticated enterprise.

allOf.description:
Specifies if new invites to this folder are restricted to users
within the enterprise. This does not affect existing
collaborations.

allowed_shared_link_access_levels.description:
A list of access levels for shared that are available
for this folder.

For some folders, like the root folder, this will always
be an empty list as sharing is not allowed at that level.

allowed_invitee_roles.description:
A list of the types of roles that user can be invited at
when sharing this folder.

allOf.description: Details about the watermark applied to this folder

Folder--Standard.description:
A standard representation of a folder, as returned from any
folder API endpoints by default

created_at.description:
The date and time when the folder was created. This value may
be `null` for some folders such as the root folder or the trash

modified_at.description:

be `null` for some folders such as the root folder or the trash
folder.

allOf.description: The optional description of this folder
allOf.example: Legal contracts for the new ACME deal

size.description:
The folder size in bytes.

Be careful parsing this integer as its
value can get very large.

The tree of folders that this folder is contained in,
starting at the root.

The user who last modified this folder.

trashed_at.description: The time at which this folder was put in the trash.

purged_at.description:
The time at which this folder is expected to be purged
from the trash.
The time at which this folder will be permanently deleted.

The date and time at which this folder was originally
created.

content_modified_at.description: The date and time at which this folder was last updated.

allOf.description: The user who owns this folder.

The shared link for this folder. This will be
`null` if no shared link has been created for this
folder.

access.description:
When this parameter has been set, users can email files
to the email address that has been automatically
created for this folder.

To create an email address, set this property either when
creating or updating the folder.

When set to `collaborators`, only emails from registered email
addresses for collaborators will be accepted. When set to `open`
it will accept emails from any email address.

email.description: The optional upload email address for this folder.

The optional folder that this folder is located within.

This value may be `null` for some folders such as the
root folder or the trash folder.

* `active` when the item has is not in the trash
* `trashed` when the item has been moved to the trash but not deleted
* `deleted` when the item has been permanently deleted.

A page of the items that are in the folder.

This field can only be requested when querying a folder's
information, not when querying a folder's items.

Group.title: Group
Group.description:
Groups contain a set of users, and can be used in place of
users in some operations, such as collaborations.

provenance.description:
Keeps track of which external source this group is
coming from (e.g. "Active Directory", "Google Groups",
"Facebook Groups").  Setting this will
also prevent Box users from editing the group name
and its members directly via the Box web application.
This is desirable for one-way syncing of groups.

external_sync_identifier.description:
An arbitrary identifier that can be used by
external group sync tools to link this Box Group to
an external group. Example values of this field
could be an Active Directory Object ID or a Google
Group ID.  We recommend you use of this field in
order to avoid issues when group names are updated in
either Box or external systems.

description.description: Human readable description of the group.
description.example: Support Group - as imported from Active Directory

invitability_level.description:
Specifies who can invite the group to collaborate
on folders (Create Collaboration).

When set to `admins_only` the enterprise admin, co-admins,
and the group's admin can invite the group.

When set to `admins_and_members` all the admins listed
above and group members can invite the group.

When set to `all_managed_users` all managed users in the
enterprise can invite the group.

member_viewability_level.description:
Specifies who can view the members of the group
(Get Memberships for Group).

* `admins_only` - the enterprise admin, co-admins, group's
  group admin
* `admins_and_members` - all admins and group members
* `all_managed_users` - all managed users in the
  enterprise

LegalHoldPolicy.title: Legal Hold Policy
LegalHoldPolicy.description:
Legal Hold Policy information describes the basic
characteristics of the Policy, such as name, description,
and filter dates.

policy_name.description: Name of the legal hold policy.

description.description:
Description of the legal hold policy. Optional
property with a 500 character limit.

status.description:
* 'active' - the policy is not in a transition state
* 'applying' - that the policy is in the process of
  being applied
* 'releasing' - that the process is in the process
  of being released
* 'released' - the policy is no longer active

allOf.description: Counts of assignments within this policy by apply-to type
The user who created the legal hold policy object

created_at.description: When the legal hold policy object was created

modified_at.description:
When the legal hold policy object was modified.
Does not update when assignments are added or removed.

deleted_at.description:
When the policy release request was sent. (Because
it can take time for a policy to fully delete, this

A [JSON-Patch](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902) operation for a

path.description:

to apply the changes to, in the format of a
[JSON-Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901).

The path must always be prefixed with a `/`.

Special characters `~` and `/` in the key must be escaped
to ensure the operation can be executed as intended.

value.description:
The value to be set or tested.

Required for `add`, `replace`, and `test` operations.

For `add`, if the value exists already the previous value will be
overwritten by the new value.

For `replace`, the value must exist before replacing.

For `test`, the existing value at the `path` location must match
the specified value.

from.description:
Required for `move` or `copy`.

The location in the metadata JSON object to move or copy from,
in the format of a
[JSON-Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901).

MetadataTemplatePatchItem.title: Metadata Template Patch Item
MetadataTemplatePatchItem.description:
A patch operation for the
changes to make to the metadata template.

The possible operations are as follows.

* `addEnumOption` Adds an enum option at the
  end of the enum option list for the specified `fieldKey`.

  Example `{"op":"addEnumOption","fieldKey":"category",
  "data":{"key":"New Option"}}`

* `addField` Adds a field at the end of the field list
  for the template.

  Example `{"op":"addField","data":{"displayName":"Category",
  "key":"category","hidden":false,"type":"string"}}`.

* `editTemplate` Allows for editing the base properties
  of a template, mainly the `displayName` and `hidden`
  properties.

  Example `{"op":"editTemplate","data":{"displayName":"Client"}}`.

* `reorderEnumOptions` Reorders the enum option list to
  match the requested enum option list.

  Example `{"op":"reorderEnumOptions","fieldKey":"category",
  "enumOptionKeys":["option2","option1","option3"]}`

* `reorderFields`  Reorders the field list to match the requested
  field list

  Example `{"op":"reorderFields","fieldKeys":["field2","field1","field3"]}`

The following changes can affect existing instances of this template.

* `editField` Edits any number of the base properties of a field, mainly
  the `displayName`, `hidden`, `description`, and `key` properties.

  If the key is changed, existing values of the specified field are
  migrated to the new key. Search indexes are updated, which can take
  time depending on how many files are affected by the change.

  Example `{"op":"editField","fieldKey":"category",
  "data":{"displayName":"Customer Group"}}`

* `editEnumOption` Edits one of the options of an enum field.

  Example `{"op":"editEnumOption","fieldKey":"years","enumOptionKey":"2011",
  "data":{"key":"2020"}}`

* `removeEnumOption` Removes the specified enum option from the
  specified enum field.

  Example `{"op":"removeEnumOption","fieldKey":"years",
  "enumOptionKey":"2011"}`

* `removeField` Removes the specified field from the template.

  Example `{"op":"removeField","fieldKey":"brand"}`

op.description: The operation type to perform on the template.

data.description: The data for the operation. Can vary depending on the operation.

fieldKeys.description:
For operations that affect multiple fields, the keys of the
fields to be affected.

enumOptionKeys.description:
For operations that affect multiple enum options,
the keys of the enum options to be affected.

RetentionPolicy.title: Retention Policy
RetentionPolicy.description:
A retention policy blocks permanent deletion of content
for a specified amount of time. Admins can create retention
policies and then later assign them to specific folders
or their entire enterprise.  To use this feature, you must
have the manage retention policies scope enabled
for your API key via your application management console.

policy_type.description:
The type of the retention policy. A retention
policy type can either be `finite`, where a
specific amount of time to retain the content is known
upfront, or `indefinite`, where the amount of time
to retain the content is still unknown.

retention_length.description:
The length of the retention policy. This length
specifies the duration in days that the retention
policy will be active for after being assigned to
content.  If the policy has A `policy_type` of
`indefinite`, the `retention_length` will also be
`indefinite`.

disposition_action.description:
The disposition action of the retention policy.
This action can be `permanently_delete`, which
will cause the content retained by the policy
to be permanently deleted, or `remove_retention`,
which will lift the retention policy from the content,
allowing it to be deleted by users,
once the retention policy time period has passed.

status.description:
The status of the retention policy. The status of
a policy will be `active`, unless explicitly retired by an
administrator, in which case the status will be `retired`.
Once a policy has been retired, it cannot become
active again.

SharedLink.title: Shared Link
SharedLink.description:
Shared links provide direct, read-only access to files or folder on Box.

Shared links with open access level allow anyone with the URL
to access the item, while shared links with company or collaborators access
levels can only be accessed by appropriately authenticated Box users.

url.description:
The URL that can be used to access the item on Box.

This URL will display the item in Box's preview UI where the file
can be downloaded if allowed.

This URL will continue to work even when a custom `vanity_url`
has been set for this shared link.

download_url.description:
A URL that can be used to download the file. This URL can be used in
a browser to download the file. This URL includes the file
extension so that the file will be saved with the right file type.

This property will be `null` for folders.

vanity_url.description:
The "Custom URL" that can also be used to preview the item on Box.  Custom
URLs can only be created or modified in the Box Web application.

access.description:
The access level for this shared link.

* `open` - provides access to this item to anyone with this link
* `company` - only provides access to this item to people the same company
* `collaborators` - only provides access to this item to people who are
   collaborators on this item

If this field is omitted when creating the shared link, the access level
will be set to the default access level specified by the enterprise admin.

effective_access.description:
The effective access level for the shared link. This can be a more
restrictive access level than the value in the `access` field when the
enterprise settings restrict the allowed access levels.

effective_permission.description: The effective permissions for this shared link.

unshared_at.description:
The date and time when this link will be disabled. This field can only be
set by users with paid accounts.

is_password_enabled.description: Defines if the shared link requires a password to access the item.

permissions.description: Defines if this link allows a user to preview and download an item.

can_download.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be downloaded. For
shared links on folders, this also applies to any items in the folder.

This value can be set to `true` when the effective access level is
set to `open` or `company`, not `collaborators`.

can_preview.description:
Defines if the shared link allows for the item to be previewed.

This value is always `true`. For shared links on folders this also
applies to any items in the folder.

download_count.description: The number of times this item has been downloaded.

preview_count.description: The number of times this item has been previewed.

SharedLink--Writable.title: Shared Link (Writable)
SharedLink--Writable.description: The writable attributes for a Shared Link.

access.description:
The level of access for the shared link. This can be
restricted to anyone with the link (`open`), only people
within the company (`company`) and only those who
have been invited to the folder (`collaborators`).

This field defaults to default access level
specified by the enterprise admin.

password.description:
The password required to access the shared link. Set this to

users with paid accounts.

can_download.description:

This can only be set when `access` is set to
`open` or `company`.

TokenRequest.title: Token Request
TokenRequest.description: A request for a new OAuth2 token

grant_type.description:
The type of request being made, either using a client-side obtained
authorization code, a refresh token, a JWT assertion, or another access
token for the purpose of downscoping a token.

client_id.description:
The Client ID of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

client_secret.description:
The client secret of the application requesting an access token.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` or
`urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer` as the `grant_type`.

code.description:
The client-side authorization code passed to your application by
Box in the browser redirect after the user has successfully
granted your application permission to make API calls on their
behalf.

Used in combination with `authorization_code` as the `grant_type`.

refresh_token.description:
A refresh token used to get a new access token with.

Used in combination with `refresh_token` as the `grant_type`.

assertion.description:
A JWT assertion for which to request a new access token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:jwt-bearer`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token.description:
The token to exchange for a downscoped token. This can be a regular
access token, a JWT assertion, or an app token.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

subject_token_type.description:
The type of `subject_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token.description:
The actor token used to create an annotator token.
This is a JWT assertion.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

actor_token_type.description:
The type of `actor_token` passed in.

Used in combination with `urn:ietf:params:oauth:grant-type:token-exchange`
as the `grant_type`.

scope.description:
The space-delimited list of scopes that you want apply to the
new access token.

The `subject_token` will need to have all of these scopes or
the call will error with **401 Unauthorized**.

resource.description: Full URL for the file that the token should be generated for.

The total number of parts expected in this upload session,

The number of parts that have been uploaded and processed

When committing a file files, inspecting this property can
provide insight if all parts have been uploaded correctly.

User.description:
A full representation of a user, as can be returned from any

WebLink.title: Web Link
WebLink.description:
Web links are objects that point to URLs. These objects
are also known as bookmarks within the Box web application.

Web link objects are treated similarly to file objects,
they will also support most actions that apply to regular files.

allOf.description: The parent object the web link belongs to

description.description:
The description accompanying the web link. This is
visible within the Box web application.

path_collection.description: The path of folders to this link, starting at the root

created_at.description: When this file was created on Boxâ€™s servers.

modified_at.description:
When this file was last updated on the Box
servers.

trashed_at.description: When this file was last moved to the trash.

purged_at.description: When this file will be permanently deleted.

allOf.description: The user who created this web link
The user who last modified this web link
The user who owns this web link

The shared link object for this item. Will be
`null` if no shared link has been created.

item_status.description:
Whether this item is deleted or not. Values include `active`,
`trashed` if the file has been moved to the trash, and `deleted` if
the file has been permanently deleted

WebLink--Mini.title: Web Link (Mini)
WebLink--Mini.description:
Web links are objects that point to URLs. These objects
are also known as bookmarks within the Box web application.

Web link objects are treated similarly to file objects,
they will also support most actions that apply to regular files.

url.description: The URL this web link points to

tags.name: Folders
tags.x-box-reference-description:
Folders represent a collection of files, web links,
and other folders. They are a key building block when
using Box Platform.

Folders also contain metadata about itself, including
who owns the folder, when it was created, and when it was
last modified.
